fieldGroup.template: Does your project require a prior favourable report from the Guarantees Commission?

Research projects that deal in whole or in part with the following subjects will require a prior favourable report from the Guarantees Commission for the Donation and Use of Human Cells and Tissues:

  • Research with human pre-embryos for the derivation of cell lines, for embryological research and for other research uses, except those related to the development and application of assisted reproduction techniques.
  • Research with human embryonic stem cells.
  • The activation of oocytes by nuclear transfer for use for therapeutic or research purposes.
  • Any other technique that, using all or part of biological samples of human origin, can lead to the obtaining of stem cells.
  • Research with embryonic cells or tissues obtained by any of the procedures indicated in the article 33.2.
  • Any other research line that includes cellular material of human embryonic origin or another functionally similar one.
  • Research with embryonic stem cell lines that come from another country, intra-community or extra-community. Such origin is to be specified in the project submitted to the report.

For more information consult article 35 of LIB 14/2007
Note: you can only answer Yes if in section '3.5 Biological samples of human origin' any of the options marked with an asterisk have been selected *.
